item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, September 18, 2024 at 3:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Why wordfreq will not be updated (559 points | 157 comments)
2. Apple mobile processors are now made in America by TSMC (1147 points | 524 comments)
3. Papermill: Parameterizing, executing, and analyzing Jupyter Notebooks (23 points | 14 comments)
4. The Dune Shell (35 points | 2 comments)
5. 0day Contest for End-of-Life Devices Announced (4 points | discuss)
6. AI tool cuts unexpected deaths in hospital by 26%, Canadian study finds (84 points | 66 comments)
7. Launch HN: Cerebrium (YC W22) – Serverless Infrastructure Platform for ML/AI (11 points | discuss)
8. Independent directors of 23andMe resign from board (518 points | 277 comments)
9. Gentle Guide to Self-Hosting (92 points | 32 comments)
10. Scramble: Open-Source Alternative to Grammarly (319 points | 136 comments)
11. Atkinson Hyperlegible Font (651 points | 179 comments)
12. Hezbollah hand-held radios detonate across Lebanon, sources say (44 points | 23 comments)
13. Knowledge graphs using Ollama and Embeddings to answer and visualizing queries (15 points | 1 comment)
14. macOS Sequoia 15 may bypass DNS encryption (496 points | 170 comments)
15. Errors from `Close` (25 points | 11 comments)
16. How Raw sockets behave differently in macOS and Linux (63 points | 24 comments)
17. Show HN: Sol – A de-minifier for shell programs (100 points | 13 comments)
18. React for R (78 points | 44 comments)
19. PeerTube 6.3 (39 points | 1 comment)
20. Scientists discover how many chemicals from food packaging enter our bodies (6 points | discuss)
21. Cobb Tuning Hit with $2.9M Fine over Emissions Defeat Devices (14 points | 17 comments)
22. GraalPy – A high-performance embeddable Python 3 runtime for Java (294 points | 123 comments)
23. A Friendly Introduction to Assembly for High-Level Programmers (216 points | 33 comments)
24. Emerge Tools (YC W21) is hiring a senior front end engineer ( | hide)
25. Asgard launches world's first DDR5-9600 DIMMs (67 points | 32 comments)
26. Reports of the death of dental cavities are greatly exaggerated (164 points | 103 comments)
27. Show HN: Open Scanner, an open-source document scanning app for iPhone (238 points | 75 comments)
28. The Lego Great Ball Contraption (271 points | 44 comments)
29. OpenTelemetry Tracing in < 200 lines of code (213 points | 28 comments)
30. John Peralta Explodes Historic Technology into Three-Dimensional Diagrams (83 points | 10 comments)
